newsitem.title: UK: Tsutsui replaces Tonomura as chairman Nomura Intl.
newsitem.headline: Tsutsui replaces Tonomura as chairman Nomura Intl.

text.p: Nomura International, the wholly-owned European subsidiary of Japan's Nomura Securities Co, said on Friday that Takashi Tsutsui would be its new chairman, replacing Hitoshi Tonomura who is returning to Tokyo shortly.

Nomura also said Tsutsui would be replaced as president of Nomura Intl by Takumi Shibata, currently president of Nomura Project Finance Intl in Hong Kong. Tonomura will become president of Nomura Securities Investment Trust Management.

Tonomura became chairman of Nomura International in May last year. He returned to London in April 1995 to chair Nomura's European Management Committee, having previously been president and then chairman of Nomura Intl in London between 1984 and 1989.
There has been a major reshuffle at Nomura in the last few months involving the resignations of two Nomura presidents and 15 other top executives over a major financial scandal.
